newsitem.title: UK: EURO OIL SWAPS FALL, MOGAS DOWN $7, FUEL DOWN $1.
newsitem.headline: EURO OIL SWAPS FALL, MOGAS DOWN $7, FUEL DOWN $1.

text.p: European oil swaps fell on Thursday morning as expectations of an early resumption of Iraqi oil exports pressured futures prices.

Gasoline led the move lower, falling $7 a tonne to trade at $213 for August compared to levels around $220 on Wednesday. September dropped nearer $4.50 a tonne to $197 as the recently steep backwardation softened slightly.
Dealers said some of the downward pressure was due to falling Brent which lost 25 cents a barrel, although CFD swaps were little changed.
Next week's CFDs traded at 30 cents under October, unchanged from Wednesday. The following two weeks held at 30 cents under and 27 cents under respectively.

Naphtha slipped $2 a tonne to talk $193.50 for August and $198.50 for September. Dealers said the Asian market had slipped into contango undermining support for European prices and upping the chances of further losses over the next few days.
Gas oil swaps were steady with September EN590 bid at $6 a tonne above the IPE, October at $7 and November at $8.
Gas oil crack spreads against Brent were holding around $4.60 a barrel for both the fourth and first quarter.
Heavy fuel swaps eased $1 a tonne to talk $94 for August with September and October at $95 and $96 respectively.
Low sulphur held at $1 above barges for August, $3 over for September and $4.50 over in the fourth quarter.
